stories.text:
I am looking to start studying a new domain as a complete novice. In this case I am learning about the energy sector and innovation, in both the public and private sector (and the overlaps).

What are the best ways to: -Learn a new domain from the ground up -Keep track of what I've learned -Write about the topic as I learn

I have tried Evernote and some of the academic PDF organizers from my time in school. I've heard good things about physical flashcards or programs that link ideas to created connected graphs.

Ideally, I would use the tool with the least friction and spend my mental energy on learning the subject matter.
stories.title: How do I learn an new domain from scratch?

stories.text:
I intend to make an online course but I am not exactly able to gauge the demand. I have worked as both mobile and web developer with around 3+ years experience in both technologies. I am also pursuing my PhD in CS inclined more towards NLP and XAI. I also consider it as my area of expertise.
The purpose to make this course to gain experience in online teaching and teaching in general but also to earn some passive income.
I have also published a course on Udemy for Laravel 3 weeks ago but it hasn't gained much traction.
stories.title: Ask HN: What online course should I teach?
